statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Jordan Allen scored 21 points, including 5 of 12 3-pointers, and Rider surged in the second half to beat Hampton 90-75 in Friday night's season opener for both teams.
article.headline: Rider beats Hampton 90-75 behind Alled
article.story: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J. -- Jordan Allen scored 21 points, including 5 of 12 3-pointers, and Rider surged in the second half to beat Hampton 90-75 in Friday night's season opener for both teams. After 12 lead changes, the Broncs pulled ahead for good on Allen's final 3-pointer, which sparked a 14-4 run for a 75-66 lead with 4:48 to play. Rider finished with an 8-0 run to win its opener for the second straight year. Stevie Jordan scored 17 points, Frederick Scott had 15 with 13 rebounds, Anthony Durham had 13 and made all three of his 3-pointers, and Tyere Marshall had 10 points with 12 rebounds for the Broncs. Hampton led by eight points three times in the first half but a 3-pointer from Allen capped a 9-1 run to tie it at 36 at halftime. Jermaine Marrow led Hampton with 21 points. Lysander Bracey had 19 and Greg Heckstall 11. --- More AP college basketball: http://collegebasketball.ap.org and http://www.twitter.com/AP-Top25
